What does the `OPTION_NATIVECURRENCY` flag do in a PBaaS chain definition?

There is no `OPTION_NATIVECURRENCY` flag in a PBaaS chain definition. The available option flags are `OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY`, `OPTION_GATEWAY`, `OPTION_PBAAS`, `OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER`, `OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER`, and `OPTION_NFT_TOKEN`.

a token, not a native currency
OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY = 64       // for PBaaS chains or gateways to potentially restrict to single currency
OPTION_GATEWAY = 128          // if set, this routes external currencies
OPTION_PBAAS = 256           // this is a PBaaS chain definition
OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 512     // this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices
OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain
OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID
```
Can you explain how to set a token as a native currency using the `OPTION_NFT_TOKEN` flag?

The `OPTION_NFT_TOKEN` flag is not used to set a token as a native currency. It is actually used to create a single satoshi NFT token that tokenizes control over the root ID. It does not have anything to do with native currencies.

a token, not a native currency
OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY = 64       // for PBaaS chains or gateways to potentially restrict to single currency
OPTION_GATEWAY = 128          // if set, this routes external currencies
OPTION_PBAAS = 256           // this is a PBaaS chain definition
OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 512     // this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices
OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain
OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID
```
What is the purpose of the `OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER` flag if it is set on a gateway?
The `OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER` flag is actually used when it is **not** set on a gateway. If it is not set, top-level ID and currency registration happen on the launch chain.

a token, not a native currency
OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY = 64       // for PBaaS chains or gateways to potentially restrict to single currency
OPTION_GATEWAY = 128          // if set, this routes external currencies
OPTION_PBAAS = 256           // this is a PBaaS chain definition
OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 512     // this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices
OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain
OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID
```
